abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Debt and Debt
            Service Reduction Loan Project (DDSR) are to assist the
            government in: 1) implementing debt and debt service
            reduction; 2) consolidating fiscal balance and structural
            reforms; and 3) normalizing relations with commercial
            creditors, reestablishing creditworthiness, and accelerating
            growth and development. DDSR will substantially enhance the
            effectiveness of the reform program in accelerating growth
            to potential by: 1) substantially reducing market
            uncertainty over Panama's ability and willingness to
            fully service its external debt, and the sizable distortions
            and costs this uncertainty entails; 2) offsetting the
            adverse effect on the investment climate and flows deriving
            from the disengagement of the U.S. from the Canal and former
            Canal Zone; and 3) reducing the debt overhang and the
            associated "tax" on future output. The project
            consists of the following components: 1) an exchange of
            original principal for par bonds, discount bonds,
            front-loaded interest reduction bonds (FLIRB) or debt
            conversion bonds; and 2) normalization of past due interest
            (PDI) through partial forgiveness, PDI payments prior to
            closing, a down payment on PDI at closing, and a PDI bond.
